title: Johnson’s Plan to Avert a Government Shutdown Passes—but Angers Some Republicans

title: Why Trump Will Keep Flip-Flopping on Abortion in 2024
description: Without Donald Trump, Roe v. Wade, would have never been overturned. But his position on abortion keeps changing with the audience.

title: Ashley Judd Won’t Stop Fighting for Women and Girls
description: In Judd's years of advocacy, she’s most proud that the women and girls she encounters are willing to share their experiences with her.

title: Manslaughter Arrest in Death of Hockey Player Whose Neck Was Cut With Skate Blade During Game
description: South Yorkshire Police did not name the suspect or provide his age. He was in police custody.

description: Studying the liars like Trump or Fox has dramatically improved my understanding of the political universe, writes Brian Stelter.

description: Here's what to know about the investigation into Adams' 2021 campaign.

description: Elinor Carucci writes about her experience photographing the collars of Ruth Bader Ginsburg for TIME.

title: Why U.S. Women Now Live Almost 6 Years Longer Than Men
description: It's the largest gender-based life expectancy gap since 1996.

title: The Bizarre True Story Behind HBO’s Love Has Won Docuseries
description: 'Love Has Won' chronicles the life and death of cult leader Amy Carlson—and how she convinced her followers she was a deity-like savior.

title: Rebound Infections Occur in 20% of Paxlovid Users, According to New Research
description: According to a new study, one in five people who take Paxlovid to treat COVID-19 end up having a rebound infection.

title: Climate Change is Hitting Every Part of Americans’ Daily Lives, Major Report Warns

description: The only bright spot is that global sales of electric passenger vehicles are now on track to match what’s needed to limit future warming.

description: As global leaders descend on San Francisco for the APEC summit, Thai Prime Minister Srettha uses the opportunity to showcase his Landbridge proposal to the West.

description: 'The legacy of sormeh persists as a proud pillar of Iranian heritage,' writes Zahra Hankir.

title: How Racism Affects the Mental Health of Black Youth
description: Mental health system is not equipped to address the critical impact racism has on Black youth, writes Amanda Calhoun.

Will the U.S. government bow before belligerent demands for intensifying confrontation and exclusion, or will it seek to deepen the recent diplomatic opening between the…

title: Nations Condemn Israeli Minister’s Comments About Dropping Nuclear Bomb on Gaza
description: China, Iran and a multitude of Arab nations condemned an Israeli minister’s statement that a nuclear bomb on the Gaza Strip was an option in the Israel-Hamas war, calling it a threat to the world.

title: Presidents Joe Biden and Joko Widodo Affirm New U.S.-Indonesia Defense Cooperation Accord
description: The deal, struck after a White House meeting between President Joe Biden and Indonesian President Joko Widodo, is part of a broader agreement that will see the nations work together on peacekeeping efforts and counterterrorism programs.

title: New Zealand Delays Crowning Best Bird After John Oliver Campaign Brings Flood of Votes
description: Bird of the Century organizers have been overwhelmed by votes after Oliver went all-out in a humorous push for his favorite, the pūteketeke.

title: Presidents Xi Jinping and Joe Biden Seek to Turn Back the Clock at San Francisco Summit
description: Relations between the world’s top two economies have spiraled in recent years. Changing that trajectory will be top of the agenda when Xi Jinping returns to San Francisco this week.

title: World Health Organization Paid Sexual Abuse Victims in Congo $250 Each, Per Internal Report
description: In interviews, recipients told the AP the money they received was hardly enough, but they wanted justice even more.

title: Biden and Xi to Announce Landmark Agreement for China to Crack Down on Fentanyl
description: The agreement would mark a win for the White House on an issue voters say is a priority for the 2024 election.

title: Nepal Bans TikTok and Tightens Control Over All Social Media Platforms
description: Authorities say the ban is in response to public claims that TikTok encourages hate speech. Critics worry the move will stifle free speech.

title: Aging Demographics Are Forcing Asian Nations to Widen Their Military Recruitment Pools
description: U.S. allies in Asia are looking beyond their traditional military recruitment profile to secure enough troops and handle the growing security challenges posed by China and North Korea.
